summary: The "Valor Earned Not Stolen Act of 2025" (H.R. 327) increases the maximum prison sentence from one year to three years for individuals who fraudulently claim to have received military decorations, including the Congressional Medal of Honor and combat badges. The bill also directs the Attorney General to conduct a study, in coordination with the Department of Veterans Affairs, to identify any government benefits wrongfully obtained through such false claims. A report detailing the study's findings and providing policy recommendations must be submitted to Congress within 180 days of the bill's enactment.
